name: GrindStoneInventory
description: The GrindStoneInventory class provides specialized access to Minecraft's grindstone interface, allowing scripts to interact with grindstone operations such as disenchanting items and repairing equipment.
overview: This class extends the base Inventory class and adds grindstone-specific functionality for managing input slots, output results, and experience calculation. Grindstones in Minecraft have three main slots: Top Input (Slot 0), Bottom Input (Slot 1), and Output (Slot 2). instances are typically obtained via Inventory.create() when a grindstone screen is open.

methods.name: getTopInput
methods.description: Gets the item currently placed in the top input slot (Slot 0) of the grindstone.

methods.name: getBottomInput
methods.description: Gets the item currently placed in the bottom input slot (Slot 1) of the grindstone.

methods.name: getOutput
methods.description: Gets the resulting item in the output slot (Slot 2). This slot contains the result of the repair or disenchanting operation.

methods.name: simulateXp
methods.description: Calculates the simulated experience point reward for the current operation. Note that actual XP rewards can vary between the calculated minimum and double that amount.
